intro: Paullinia triantennata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming an invasive species.
